Package fr.cnrs.iees.uit.space

Interface Box

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Dimensioned
    public interface Box
extends Dimensioned

    A rectangular box in a n-dimensional space, aligned on coordinate axes.

    This was designed to manipulate the concept of a finite block of space independent of the space dimension. If dim=1, this will represent a segment, if dim=2 a rectangle, if dim=3 a rectangular cuboid, etc.

    The assumption of alignment with the coordinate axes allows important optimisations and should not be released

    Immutable.

    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 07-08-2018

    • Method Detail

      • lowerBounds

        Point lowerBounds()

        In two dimensions, this would be the coordinates of the lower left corner of the box.

        Returns:
        the lower bounds of this Box.

      • upperBounds

        Point upperBounds()

        In two dimensions, this would be the coordinates of the upper right corner of the box.

        Returns:
        the upper bounds of this Box.

        Returns:

      • overlaps

        default boolean overlaps​(Box other)

        Test for strict overlapping, i.e. boxes with a common edge are considered not overlapping. In topological terms, returns true if the closed sets represented by the boxes overlap.

        Parameters:
        other - a box to test for overlap with this one
        Returns:
        true if this Box overlaps the one passed as argument

      • contains

        default boolean contains​(Point p)

        Tests for wide containement, i.e. a point lying on the box edges is considered inside the box. In topological terms, returns true if the point is in the open set represented by this box.

        Instantiate
        Parameters:
        p - a point to test for falling into this box
        Returns:
        true if this box contains the point passed as argument

      • isPointOnBorder

        default boolean isPointOnBorder​(Point p)
        Tests if a point is on the border of a box
        Parameters:
        p - a point to test for falling on the edge of the box
        Returns:
        true if the point is on the edge

      • contains

        default boolean contains​(Box b)
        Test if a box is fully contained in this one (wide containment, cf. contains(Point)).
        Parameters:
        b - a Box to test for fully being contained into this one
        Returns:
        true if this box contains the box passed as argument

      • centre

        default Point centre()
        Compute the centroid of this box.
        Returns:
        the centroid of this box.

      • size

        double size()
        Compute the length / surface / volume / hypervolume (according to dimension) of this box.
        Returns:
        the box size relevant to its space

      • boundingBox

        static Box boundingBox​(Point A,
                       Point B)
        Build the smallest box containing two points. Use this method to build a Box without checking if the Points suitably contain lower and upper values only. Of course the points must be of the same dimension, otherwise an Exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        A - a Point
        B - another Point
        Returns:
        the smallest Box containing points A and B.

      • contains

        default boolean contains​(Sphere s)
        Test if a Sphere is fully contained in this box (wide containment, cf. contains(Point)).
        Parameters:
        s - a Sphere to test for fully being contained into this one
        Returns:
        true if this box contains the sphere passed as argument

      • boundingBox

        static Box boundingBox​(Sphere s)
        Build the smallest Box containing a Sphere.
        Parameters:
        s - the Sphere to wrap into a Box
        Returns:
        the smallest Box containing Sphere s

      • boundingCube

        static Box boundingCube​(Sphere s)
        Build the smallest (hyper)cubic Box containing a Sphere. By cubic we mean a Box having the same side length in all dimensions.

        Note: yes, this is returning the same result as boundingBox(Sphere). Thank you for your careful reading.

        Parameters:
        s - the Sphere to wrap into a Box
        Returns:
        the smallest Box containing Sphere s

      • boundingCube

        static Box boundingCube​(Point A,
                        Point B)
        Build the smallest (hyper)cubic Box containing two points. By cubic we mean a Box having the same side length in all dimensions.
        Parameters:
        A - a Point
        B - another Point
        Returns:
        the smallest cubic Box containing points A and B.

      • sideLength

        default double sideLength​(int i)
        Access to the length of any side of the box.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the requested side length
        Returns:
        the length of the side of the box in ith dimension

      • isCube

        default boolean isCube()
        Test if this box is (hyper)cubic, i.e. if all its side lengths are equal. A hypercube is a generalisation of a cube to n>3 dimensions.

        NB: as you noticed it, this method always returns true in dimension 1.

        Returns:
        true if this Box is a square, cube or hypercube.

      • valueOf

        static Box valueOf​(java.lang.String s)
        Builds a Box instance from a String - assumes the String has been produced previously with a call to toString() method of a Box implementation
        Parameters:
        s - the string to parse
        Returns:
        the new Box instance
